<h1>TelegramWeather</h1>
<p>To try type in telegram search bar: <b>@WeatherStudio_bot</b></p>
<p>
  <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/working%20with-telegram-blue?logo=data:image/png;base64,"/>
  <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/python-100%25-blue"/><br>
  <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/%20languages-2-brightgreen"/>
  <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/%20-en-brightgreen?logo=data:image/png;base64,"/>
  <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/%20-pl-brightgreen?logo=data:image/png;base64,">
</p>
<br>
<p>This bot will tell you what the weather is like in the city of your choice.</p>
<br>
<br>
<br>
<h3>To work with files you need to</h3>
<hr>
<h3>Install the following libraries:</h3>
<h2><b>Telebot</b></h2>
<a href='https://pytba.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html#'>TeleBot</a> is synchronous and asynchronous implementation of Telegram Bot API
<br>
<h3><b>Installation</b></h3>
<p>python -m pip install pytelegrambotapi</p>
<hr>
<h3>Create your own bot in telegram</h3>
* Make an account in telegram <a href="https://web.telegram.org/k/">here</a><br>
* In search bar find @BotFather<br>
* Use it to make your own bot and receive API token<br>
* In file Keys.py assign your API token to the __apiTelegramKey varaible<br>
<hr>
<h3>Get your API key to use OpenWeather</h3>
* Make an account in OpenWeather <a href="https://openweathermap.org/">here</a><br>
* In file Keys.py assign your API key to the __apiWeatherKey varaible<br>
<hr>
